metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2284 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2284` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm19').
